name: Wenqi
personal background: • Gratefully receive a grant (Intra-Faculty Interdisciplinary Project) as the PC/Co-PI to support our research. • Our tutorial on “Recommender Systems in the Era of Large Language Models (LLMs)” is accepted byICDM 2023. Congratulations to Jiatong, Zihuai, and Yunqing. • Gratefully receive a grant (RGC-GRF) as the Co-I to support our research. • Our workshop on “Large Language Models (LLMs) for Graph Learning” is accepted by The Web Conference 2024 (WWW 2024). • Our new preprint “Empowering Molecule Discovery for Molecule-Caption Translation with Large Language Models: Certified Robustness for Large Language Models with Self-Denoising” is online. • One paper (“Revisiting Link Prediction: A data perspective”) got accepted byICLR 2024. • Two papers (“Linear-Time Graph Neural Networks for Scalable Recommendations” and “Fast Graph Condensation with Structure-based Neural Tangent Kernel”) got accepted byACM TheWeb Conference (WWW) 2024. - Our background is from a strong academic foundation and extensive research experience. - We have been serving as PC members for various top-tier conferences, including KDD, IJCAI, NeurIPS, WWW, ICML, ICLR, WSDM, and others. - We are actively involved in organizing tutorials at prominent conferences, such as Web Conference (WWW) and International Joint Conference on Artificial Intelligence (IJAI). - Our work has been recognized with awards, including the SDM2020Student Travel Award. - We have published papers in top-tier venues, such as NeurIPS/CIKM, KDD, WWW, IJCAI, and ICML. - We have also had our preprints accepted by other prominent conferences and journals. None * Wenqi Fan is a researcher. * He has collaborated with many other researchers on various projects. * Some of his notable works include "Fairly Adaptive Negative Sampling for Recommendations", "Jointly Attacking Graph Neural Network and its Explanations", and "A Comprehensive Survey on Automated Machine Learning for Recommendations". * His research interests are in the areas of recommender systems, graph neural networks, and fairness. * He has published papers in various conferences and journals, including IJCAI 2023, WWW 2023, ICDE 2023, NeurIPS 2022, CIKM 2022, KDD 2022, SIGIR 2022, and AAAI 2022.
research interest:
• Recommender Systems (RecSys)andManagement Information Systems (MIS)
• Large Language Models (LLMs)
• Trustworthy AI: Adversarial Attacks & Robustness; Fairness; Explainability, etc.
• Graph Machine Learning: Graph Neural Networks; Graph Foundation Models 
• AI/ML/DM + X: Business; Science • Two students received PolyU Presidential PhD Fellowship Scheme (PPPFS) to support their PhD study.
• Our workshop on “Large Language Models (LLMs) for Graph Learning” is accepted by The Web Conference 2024 (WWW 2024).
• Our tutorial on “Recommender Systems in the Era of Large Language Models (LLMs)” is accepted byICDM 2023.
• Congratulations to Jiatong, Zihuai, and Yunqing.
• Our new preprint “Certified Robustness for Large Language Models with Self-Denoising” is online.
• Our new preprint “Exploring the Potential of Large Language Models (LLMs) in Learning on Graphs” is online.
• Our new preprint “Recommender Systems in the Era of Large Language Models (LLMs)” is online.
• Gratefully receive a grant (RGC-GRF) as the Co-I to support our research.
• Our new preprint “Empowering Molecule Discovery for Molecule-Caption Translation with Large Language Models: A ChatGPT Perspective” is online.
• Congratulations to Chengyi, Yunqing, and Jiatong for their first paper with PolyU.
• Our paper (“Adversarial Attacks for Black-box Recommender Systems via Copying Transferable Cross-domain User Profiles”) got accepted byIEEE TKDE 2023.
• One paper got accepted bySIGIR 2023.
• Our new preprint “Generative Diffusion Models on Graphs: Methods and Applications” is online.
• Our tutorial on “Trustworthy Recommender Systems: Foundations and Frontiers” is accepted byKDD 2023[Website].
• Our tutorial on “Trustworthy Recommender Systems: Foundations and Frontiers” is accepted byIJCAI 2023[Website].
• Our survey paper (“Generative Diffusion Models on Graphs: Methods and Applications”) got accepted byIJCAI 2023.
• One paper (Jointly Attacking Graph Neural Network and its Explanations) got accepted byICDE’2023.
• Our tutorial on “AutoML for Deep Recommender Systems: Fundamentals and Advances” is accepted for the WSDM Conference (WSDM’2023) [Website].
• Our new preprint “A Comprehensive Survey on Trustworthy Recommender Systems” is online.
• One paper (Fairness Reprogramming) got accepted byNeurIPS’2022.
• One paper (Identifying The Kind Behind SMILES - Anatomical Therapeutic Chemical Classification using Structure-Only Representations) got accepted byBIB’2022(Impact Factor: 13.994).
• One paper (Disentangled Contrastive Learning for Social Recommendation) got accepted byCIKM’2022.
• Invited to serve as the (Senior) PC Member ofAAAI’2023andICLR’2023.
• Our survey paper <Safety & Robustness, Non-discrimination & Fairness, Explainability, Privacy, Accountability & Auditability, and Environmental Well-Being>
publication:
30 July, 2024 International Web Information Systems Engineering conference (also known as the WISE conference), 2024.

<Research Interests>
• Data Mining, Machine Learning, and Artificial Intelligence, with a particular focus on:
    • Recommender Systems (RecSys)andManagement Information Systems (MIS)
    • Large Language Models (LLMs)
    • Trustworthy AI: Adversarial Attacks & Robustness; Fairness; Explainability, etc.
    • Graph Machine Learning: Graph Neural Networks; Graph Foundation Models
    • AI/ML/DM + X: Business; Science
